under section 420 r/w 34 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Patole for the applicants. By taking me through the copy of FIR in present crime and the another report given by applicant No.2 to police on 12­12­2018, on the basis of which C. R. No. 604/2018 was registered. The learned advocate submitted that accused / applicants are falsely implicated in the present crime. They are law abiding citizens and respected citizens and they have not committed any offence and the report is given to the police just to counter the earlier report given by applicant No.2. Considering the allegations made in FIR, the documents filed on record, I find it proper to grant interim protection to the applicants till the respondent, i.e. police file their reply to the application. Hence, the following order.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Patole for the applicants.
By taking me through the copy of FIR in present crime and the another report given by applicant No.2 to police on 12­12­2018, on the basis of which C. R. No. 604/2018 was registered.
The learned advocate submitted that accused / applicants are falsely implicated in the present crime.
They are law abiding citizens and respected citizens and they have not committed any offence and the report is given to the police just to counter the earlier report given by applicant No.2.

Considering the allegations made in FIR, the documents filed on record, I find it proper to grant interim protection to the applicants till the respondent, i.e. police file their reply to the application.

order.text: ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Nos.[1] Vasant Dhudaku Patil, [2] Ms. Asmita Anil Rao, [3] Mrs. Sangita Ram Bhise, [4] Mr. Ram Shankar Bhise, [5] Ms. Rupali Dilip Faltane and [6] Mr. Adity Vitthal Mahadik in Cri.B.A.No. 64/2019 2 CNR No.MHPU01­000240­2019 C. R. No. 06/2019 registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420, 34 of the Indian Penal Code, applicants be released on their furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ each with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicants shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicants shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and they shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicants shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 19­01­2019. [3] The applicants shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 19­01­ 2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly.

footer: Pune, Dated/­04­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Cri.B.A.No. 64/2019 3 CNR No.MHPU01­000240­2019 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Shri. V. V. processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No.64/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000240­2019 Vasant D. Patil and another …. Applicants. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.5 This is an application filed by the applicants for interim anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Cr. P. C. in C. R. No.06/2019,registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Patole for the applicants. By taking me through the copy of FIR in present crime and the another report given by applicant No.2 to police on 12­12­2018, on the basis of which C. R. No. 604/2018 was registered. The learned advocate submitted that accused / applicants are falsely implicated in the present crime. They are law abiding citizens and respected citizens and they have not committed any offence and the report is given to the police just to counter the earlier report given by applicant No.2. Considering the allegations made in FIR, the documents filed on record, I find it proper to grant interim protection to the applicants till the respondent, i.e. police file their reply to the application. Hence, the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Nos.[1] Vasant Dhudaku Patil, [2] Ms. Asmita Anil Rao, [3] Mrs. Sangita Ram Bhise, [4] Mr. Ram Shankar Bhise, [5] Ms. Rupali Dilip Faltane and [6] Mr. Adity Vitthal Mahadik in Cri.B.A.No. 64/2019 2 CNR No.MHPU01­000240­2019 C. R. No. 06/2019 registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420, 34 of the Indian Penal Code, applicants be released on their furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ each with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicants shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicants shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and they shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicants shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 19­01­2019. [3] The applicants shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 19­01­ 2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
Pune, Dated/­04­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Cri.B.A.No. 64/2019 3 CNR No.MHPU01­000240­2019 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Shri. V. V. Bannur Name of Court : Shri. A. Y. Thatte, District Judge 15 and ASJ, Pune. Judgment signed by PO on : ­4­1­2019 Judgment uploaded on :­ 5­1­2019
